page.title: 01OVERVIEW, KIRKBY UNDERWOOD
page.content: This is a rural area of undulating land. Approximately two-thirds of the area is farmland and a large proport- ion of the remainder woodland. In the S.E.corner of the area lies the village of{KIRKBY UNDERWOOD}with a population of 150 whilst the hamlet{ {of HANTHORPE}in the S.W. has a popul- ation of 20. There are a handful of outlying farms and houses ,amounting to another 30 people. In the centre of this block lies {TEMPLE WOOD,}and its northern boundry is adjacent to an old aerodrome, now used as storage for vintage vehicles. Less than a mile to the E.runs the A15 Sleaford to Peterborough which effectively marks the edge of the Lincolnshire Fens. Features of the landscape are police and British Telecom radar towers.
